title: 114_s2198
content: The Act may be cited as the "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2015" and includes a grant program regarding firearms. The "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2015" includes a grant program where the Director of the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services may provide grants to eligible States to support the implementation of specific policies, procedures, laws, or regulations related to law enforcement agencies or courts. An eligible State seeking a grant under the "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2015" must submit an application to the Director of the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services, containing information as required. The State policies and procedures must relate to firearms or ammunition possession and transfer, imposing restrictions and penalties similar to or more comprehensive than specified in the Act. The "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2015" requires the seizure of firearms and ammunition from individuals convicted of certain crimes or under a protection order. State and local courts must consider individuals arrested for relevant crimes who possess firearms or ammunition that may be used. The "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2015" authorizes the seizure of firearms and ammunition in domestic violence situations if there is probable cause to believe they pose a threat. State and local courts can issue protection orders prohibiting possession of firearms and requiring surrender or seizure in such cases. The "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2015" allows for the seizure of firearms and ammunition in domestic violence cases where there is a threat. Protection orders can be issued by state and local courts to prohibit possession of firearms and require surrender or seizure. The Act also provides for the safe return of seized or surrendered firearms and ammunition once certain conditions are met. The "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2015" allows for the seizure of firearms and ammunition in domestic violence cases. Once determined not to be contraband, they can be safely returned under certain conditions without endangering victims or protected persons. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the implementation of this section.
